data.title: Snoop Dogg, Wiz Khalifa Call for Peace After Drakeo the Ruler's Death
data.text:
Snoop Dogg and Wiz Khalifa are calling for peace in the wake of Drakeo the Rulerâ€™s death.

The West Coast rapper was fatally stabbed during an altercation at the Once Upon a Time in L.A. festival on Saturday night (Dec. 18).

A grieving Snoop, who was set to close out the concert later in the evening, mourned the tragic loss and urged for unity in hip-hop.

â€œIâ€™m saddened by the events that took place last night at the Once Upon a Time in LA festival,â€ he tweeted. â€œMy condolences go out to the family and loved ones of Drakeo the Ruler.â€

Snoop said he learned of the deadly incident while backstage. â€œIâ€™m not with anything negative and as one of the many performers, I was there to spread positive vibes only to my city of LA. Last night I was in my dressing room when I was informed about the incident and chose to immediately leave the festival grounds.â€

He continued, â€œMy prayers go out to everyone affected by tragedy. Please take care, love one another and stay safe yall. IM PRAYING FOR PEACE IN HIP HOP.â€

Without directly mentioning Drakeo, Wiz Khalifa addressed the surge of violence in hip-hop while calling for change.

â€œAs enternainers lets try some shit next year. Minding our own business. Not dis respecting each others family, dead homies, or area they come from. Stop using someone elseâ€™s significant other as a one up to the other person. Actually showing the same love you expect to get,â€ he wrote.

â€œNot sayÄ±n any of these are a direct cause of violence but changin em could help,â€ added Wiz.

Meanwhile, Drake paid tribute to his friend and â€œTalk to Meâ€ collaborator with a heartfelt post. â€œNah man this sh*t isnâ€™t right for real wtf are we doing ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜”ğŸ˜”,â€ he wrote on Instagram Stories. â€œAlways picked my spirit up with your energy RIP Drakeo.â€
